decision_conditions: The details received pursuant to condition 3 (Materials) are considered insufficient. The proposed materials to be used for the hardstanding would not be porous and are contradictory to the details provided within the landscape scheme. In its current form, it is not considered that sufficient information has been received to demonstrate that the proposal would not be detrimental to the character and appearance of the proposed development and the visual amenity of the street scene and the wider area. The proposal is thus contrary to Policies BE13 and BE19 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Saved UDP Policies (November 2012).

The details received pursuant to condition 4 (Landscaping) are considered insufficient. The proposal fails to provide the required details of planting and hard landscaping. In its current form, it is not considered that sufficient information has been received to demonstrate that the proposal would enhance the visual amenities of the locality or provide adequate facilities. In the absence of such, the scheme fails to comply with Policy BE38 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two Saved UDP Policies (November 2012)
description: Details pursuant to condition 3 (Materials) and 4 (Landscape scheme) of planning permission Ref: 16109/APP/2018/3607 dated 25/01/2019 (Demolition of existing dwellinghouse and erection of a new building to provide 7 x 2-bed and 1 x 3-bed self-contained flats with associated parking, cycle and refuse store, amenity space and landscaping and widening of existing vehicular access)
